HauskrechtCS 441 Discrete mathematics for CS Cartesian product (review) Let A={a1, a2, ..ak} and B={b1,b2,..bm}. The Cartesian product A x B is defined by a set of pairs {(a1 b1), (a1, b2), … (a1, bm), …, (ak,bm)}. Cartesian product defines a product set, or a set of all ordered arrangements of elements in sets in the Cartesian product. 2 M. HauskrechtCS 441 Discrete mathematics for CS Binary relation Definition: Let A and B be two sets. A binary relation from A to B is a subset of a Cartesian product A x B. •Let R A x B means R is a set of ordered pairs of the form (a,b) where a A and b B. • We use the notation a R b to denote (a,b) R and a R b to denote (a,b) R. If a R b, we say a is related to b by R. Example: Let A={a,b,c} and B={1,2,3}. • Is R={(a,1),(b,2),(c,2)} a relation from A to B? Yes. • Is Q={(1,a),(2,b)} a relation from A to B? No. • Is P={(a,a),(b,c),(b,a)} a relation from A to A? Yes M.
